author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: Kim Keon Hee, wife of impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, was arrested late Tuesday in an ongoing investigation into allegations ranging from suspected stock manipulation to bribery, investigators said.
title: South Korea Prosecutors Arrest Ex-First Lady in Corruption Probe

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: The Bank of Thailand is expected to cut its key rate at the last meeting to be led by outgoing Governor Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput, as policymakers look to shield the economy from the risks of US tariffs and deflation.
title: Thailand Set to Cut Rate in Last Meeting Before New Leadership

author: Carolina Millan
description: Mexico’s government transferred 26 inmates with ties to organized crime to face charges in the US, in its latest push to work closely with Washington on combating powerful drug cartels.
title: Mexico Sends 26 Prisoners With Links to Organized Crime to US

author: Josh Xiao, Colum Murphy
description: President Xi Jinping relies on legions of local officials to govern China’s 1.4 billion people. A rare protest over the brutal attack of a schoolgirl has inflamed concerns over their credibility.
title: Rare China Protest Reveals Resistance to Xi’s Frontline Officers

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, US economy reporter Augusta Saraiva looks at the reaction to the president’s pick to lead the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Jobs Data Drama Boils Down to What, and Who, to Trust

author: Enda Curran
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent suggested that the Federal Reserve ought to be open to a bigger, 50 basis-point cut in the benchmark interest rate next month, after having skipped a move at the last meeting.
title: Bessent Hints Fed Should Be Open to a Half-Point Rate Cut

author: Edward Bolingbroke
description: A largely benign US inflation report is bolstering the case for traders betting that the Federal Reserve will soon cut interest rates, with some seeing an increased possibility of an outsize reduction.
title: Bets on Outsize Fed Cut Gain Steam as Inflation Data Backs Doves

author: Liam Knox, Josh Wingrove, Skylar Woodhouse
description: Harvard University has signaled it’s willing to pay $500 million for workforce training programs as part of a settlement with the White House to restore more than $2 billion in frozen federal funds, according to a person familiar with the negotiations.
title: Harvard Ready to Pay $500 Million for Job Training in Trump Deal

author: Gerry Smith
description: At least a dozen countries are interested in developing their own vaccines because they’re losing confidence that the US government will have immunizations ready for the next pandemic, a top biotech investor said.
title: Other Nations Move Toward Making Their Own Vaccines as US Cuts Funding

author: Michael D McDonald
description: The Panama Canal is planning to enter the ports business with a tender for two terminals, a move that comes amid a high-profile clash between the US and China over the waterway.
title: Panama Canal to Enter Ports Business as Trump-China Feud Simmers

author: Eric Martin
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio spoke with his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov to prepare for Friday’s summit between the two countries’ presidents, even as he reiterated the meeting may not lead to a breakthrough in the Ukraine conflict.
title: Rubio Speaks With Russia’s Lavrov Ahead of Trump-Putin Meeting

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US sanctioned an armed group and two Hong Kong-based firms linked to violence and illegal mining in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, part of what officials said was an effort to combat exploitation of conflict minerals in the region.
title: US Sanctions Armed Group and Hong Kong Firms Over Congo Mining

author: Misha Savic
description: Bosnia-Herzegovina’s top court said ethnic Serb leader Milorad Dodik can pay a fine instead of serving a year in prison for defying orders stemming from the peace deal that ended the Balkan country’s civil war three decades ago.
title: Bosnia’s Serb Leader Dodik Avoids Prison Term as Elections Loom

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Olesia Safronova
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he won’t cede the eastern region of Donbas to Russia and pushed for Kyiv to be included in talks over Ukrainian territory as the US and Russian leaders prepare to meet on Friday.
title: Zelenskiy Says Ukraine Won’t Withdraw Troops From Donbas

author: Liam Knox
description: The Department of Justice said George Washington University violated federal civil rights law during pro-Palestinian student protests last year, making it the latest target in the Trump administration’s campaign to exert power over US colleges.
title: George Washington Is Latest University Targeted by Trump

author: Nicolle Yapur, Giovanna Bellotti Azevedo
description: Javier Milei’s reforms have brought stability to Argentina’s chaotic foreign exchange market and praise from investors. But the overhaul is also fueling the worst streak of corporate defaults since the pandemic.
title: Milei’s FX Reforms Spur Worst Corporate Default Wave Since 2020

author: Dasha Afanasieva, Indy Scholtens
description: The Israeli embassy in The Hague was vandalized early Tuesday as suspects smeared the entrance with red paint and smashed its glass doors.
title: Israeli Embassy in the Netherlands Vandalized, Suspects Arrested

author: Alex Vasquez
description: The leader of Canada’s main oil-producing province visited Mexico in a bid to help reset relations with Latin America’s second-largest economy, with a particular eye to promoting energy projects.
title: Alberta Bolsters Canada-Mexico Energy Ties as Trump Upends Trade

author: Krystof Chamonikolas
description: The Czech Defense Ministry approved a plan to buy an initial 44 Leopard 2A8 tanks from Germany for 32.8 billion koruna ($1.6 billion).
title: Czech Defense Ministry Approves Plan to Buy 44 Leopard Tanks

author: Josh Wingrove, Todd Gillespie
description: President Donald Trump assailed Goldman Sachs Group Inc. Chief Executive Officer David Solomon, saying the bank made a “bad prediction” about the impact of Trump’s sweeping tariff agenda on markets and consumer costs.
title: Trump Mocks Goldman CEO, Says Bank Made Bad Call on Tariffs

author: Wojciech Moskwa
description: Poland’s government will deport 63 Ukrainians and Belarusians for taking part in mass altercations during a music concert in Warsaw last weekend, said Prime Minister Donald Tusk.
title: Poland to Deport 63 Ukrainians, Belarusians After Concert Fracas

author: Joe Mayes
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is drawing up plans for another overhaul of Britain’s planning rules, in a bid to speed up the delivery of infrastructure and boost economic growth.
title: UK’s Reeves Seeks Fresh Planning Overhaul in Growth Push

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he is considering allowing a lawsuit to proceed against Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell over the renovation of the central bank’s headquarters, a project whose cost overruns have drawn scrutiny.
title: Trump Says He May Allow Lawsuit Against Powell Over Fed Renovation

author: Samuel Stolton, Alessandra Migliaccio, Sonia Sirletti
description: Italy has pushed back against European Union criticism of Rome’s power to block or limit deals, which Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni recently used in UniCredit SpA’s now-failed attempt to acquire Banco BPM SpA.
title: Italy Defends Right to Restrict UniCredit’s BPM Bid in EU Reply

author: Iain Rogers
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s CDU/CSU bloc again slipped behind the far-right Alternative for Germany party in a voter poll, while the German leader’s personal approval rating sank to the lowest level since he took office three months ago.
title: Merz’s Conservative Bloc Slips Behind Far Right in New Survey

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland adopts further sanctions against Russia, following the 18th sanctions package of the European Union, the government said in a statement.
title: Switzerland Adopts Additional EU Sanctions Against Russia

author: Andrea Dudik
description: China said it will cease engagement with Czech President Petr Pavel over his meeting with the Dalai Lama, escalating diplomatic tensions between the two countries.
title: China Cuts Relations With Czech President Over Dalai Lama Visit

author: Lyubov Pronina
description: The European Union intends to finally roll out its new digital border control system in October, changing how it handles the entry of hundreds of millions of people who visit the bloc every year.
title: What the EU’s Entry/Exit System Will Mean for Travelers to Europe

author: Colum Murphy
description: News that one of China’s most senior diplomats has apparently been detained is just the latest big-name disappearance.
title: Xi’s Unsettling Crackdown on Top Chinese Officials

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Singapore and the US have ended plans to base Republic of Singapore Air Force fighter jets in Guam, the Ministry of Defense said Tuesday, citing a review of training needs.
title: Singapore, US Drop Plans for F-15 Fighter Jet Detachment in Guam

author: Sofia Sorochinskaia
description: Syria’s transitional government is interested in restoring Russian military police patrols in the country’s southern provinces, according to Kommersant.
title: Syria Open to Resuming Russian Patrols in South, Kommersant Says

author: Hallie Gu, Pratik Parija
description: China has eased curbs on urea shipments to India, in the latest indication of a thaw in tensions between Beijing and New Delhi as US President Donald Trump’s trade policies target the two Asian nations.
title: China Loosens Urea Exports to India in Sign of Thawing Tensions

author: Chandra Asmara, Eko Listiyorini
description: Indonesia will continue diplomatic talks with Malaysia over the oil-rich blocks in disputed waters instead of pursuing legal action, according to a senior official.
title: Indonesia Says to Continue Talks With Malaysia Over Disputed Sea

author: Tooba Khan
description: The US declared the Balochistan Liberation Army a terrorist organization, a group that Pakistan has long sought to outlaw internationally, as ties between Islamabad and Washington strengthen.
title: US Names Outlawed Pakistani Group as Terrorist Organization

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkish authorities detained 30 people in a new wave of investigations into the opposition-controlled municipalities of Istanbul and Antalya on Tuesday, local media reported
title: Turkey’s Opposition-Run Municipalities Face New Probes, NTV Says

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa will submit a revised trade-framework deal to the US as it seeks to reduce a 30% tariff imposed by President Donald Trump.
title: South Africa Cabinet Backs Submission of Revised US-Trade Offer

author: Krystof Chamonikolas
description: Czech opposition leader and billionaire former Prime Minister Andrej Babis pledged to reverse the current government’s fiscal-austerity measures if he returns to power after October elections.
title: Billionaire Vows to Undo Czech Austerity If Elected, Dnes Says

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Alessandra Migliaccio, Daniele Lepido
description: Giorgia Meloni’s government is considering plans to curb Chinese investors’ holdings at key companies to avoid potential tensions with the US.
title: Meloni Seeks to Shrink Chinese Holdings at Key Italian Companies

author: Julian Lee
description: Threat of additional tariffs on India hasn’t impacted crude shipments from Russian ports
title: Russia Keeps Crude Exports Flowing Ahead of Trump-Putin Summit

author: Neil Jerome Morales
description: The Philippines said it’s “seriously concerned” with the “dangerous maneuvers” of Chinese vessels this week and called out Beijing for its “unlawful interference” with a routine humanitarian operation.
title: Philippines Says Seriously Concerned With China Ships’ Actions

author: Tom Rees
description: A plunge in UK employment showed some signs of easing in July, suggesting that a shake-out in the jobs market since Labour ramped up taxes for businesses may be coming to an end.
title: UK Loses Fewer Jobs Than Forecast as Reeves’ Tax Hit Fades

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva spoke with his Chinese counterpart following talks with the leaders of India and Russia, as part of his outreach to allies after Donald Trump thrust Latin America’s biggest economy into the middle of his global trade war.
title: Xi Takes Aim at US ‘Protectionism’ in Phone Call With Lula

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te’s approval rating has dropped to the lowest level since he took office last year, underscoring the hit he has taken from a range of political setbacks.
title: Taiwan’s Lai Sees Approval at Lowest of Tenure After Setbacks

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung will visit the US this month for his first meeting with President Donald Trump since taking office in June, a high-stakes trip set to spotlight a recently inked trade deal between the allies as well as security issues they share.
title: South Korea’s Lee to Visit US for First Meeting With Trump

author: John Liu, Colum Murphy
description: China’s foreign-policy apparatus is again facing questions about succession after the reported questioning of a top figure who had been widely viewed as the nation’s next foreign minister.
title: Xi Foreign Policy Team in Doubt on Diplomat’s Reported Detention

author: John Liu, Colum Murphy
description: China’s foreign-policy apparatus is again facing questions about succession after the reported questioning of a top figure who had been widely viewed as the nation’s next foreign minister.
title: Xi’s ‘Probe’ of Diplomat Puts China Foreign Policy Team in Doubt
